name: Castle Leslie Estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have previously stayed at the Castle but was keen to avail of the spa so opted for the Lodge this visit. My husband booked the pamper deal whereby we both got treatments & evening meal. The treatments were wonderful & we lounged in the relaxation room before & after. We lounged in Connor's Bar as well!! My husband can recommend the Guiness. Our evening meal was a real treat. The staff are impressively trained - traditional attention to detail with a friendly, approachable manner. Our room was not as impressive as the accomodation in the Castle but a thoroughly enjoyable visit which we hope to repeat.
reviews.title: bliss...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Stayed in the mauve room. Stunning views and the room is beautiful. Would have preferred a modern toilet but that's a personal thing. The food in snaffles restaurant was amazing as was the service, I would highly recommend the venison!
reviews.title: Little piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was the service in the hotel wasn't up to scratch. We phoned for a bottle opener and it wasn't brought to the room and later when we wanted to get a drink in the hotel before dinner and we couldn't find anyone to serve us.
reviews.title: A Bit Of A Disappointment :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However the castle is really worth a visit I felt totally relaxed and like a princess!
reviews.title: Sophisticated hen weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a nights stay at the lodge ..have been here before and had one night at the lodge and second night at the castle and had a magical time so couldnt wait to go back so when it came to our anniversary i thought it was a great excuse to visit and was "as i said" a bit disappointed...first off they had only the superior rooms left(more money) so was happy when i heard there was a balcony but what we got was doors that opened onto nothing as there was a railing in front of the doors(so dont know why they call this a balcony :( also we looked out onto a bit of over grown WEEDS...not a pretty view in sight so dont know what i was paying extra for :(
reviews.title: Great riding vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was he venue for our wedding, and I honestly don't know how it could have been any better. The staff were incredibly helpful, without being overbearing, from the second we arrived. The food and drink were fabulous. The rooms (in the Castle) are absolutely amazing, each with its own unique charm. The grounds are perfect for meandering around. And the time we spent just lounging around, reading papers, drinking tea and chatting with friends and family, was simply bliss.
reviews.title: Impossible to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are planning on being anywhere near here, you really should try to stay here.
reviews.title: A wonderful find to a short escape from the city...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has oodles of character. My wife and I had a short weekend break there recently. It is quite literally someone's manor house ... in fact our Green room was right beside that of the lord of the manor who normally mingles with the guests. Each bedroom has its own unique features and I would recommend request a few options while booking. Not every room will be to every taste ... so you need to consider your own when booking. We originally were booked in one of the basement rooms but asked to be moved. The Green room is one of the nicest but has the disadvantage of not being en-suite.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The estate is lovely - plenty of nice walks and activities such as horse riding, fishing on the lake or shooting clays. Its a perfect 2 day getaway where you can dump the car and spend the entire stay on the estate or in the cute little town of Glaslough which is on its borders.
reviews.title: Great break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I loved the bar and social areas of the castle because it is big enough to allow you to disappear privately in the library or one of the living rooms ... or small enough so that you can join the other guests if you are feeling social. Its the small size that really makes the place feel like your are the lord of your own manor. There is also a hidden area through the servants quarters where you can play snooker or above it a full cinema complete with comfy leather seats.
reviews.title: Friendly Luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a weekend in a suite at the lodge, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. The suite was beautifully furnished and huge! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Going for a hack through the beautiful grounds was a highlight, and the soak in the roll top bath afterwards was also lovely! The breakfast both mornings was very good, and our dinner in Snaffles restaurant was excellent - and the night was finished off in style with some piano playing from Jack!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, beautiful grounds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only downside is that there was a wedding on in the castle that weekend so we couldn't go for a peak inside, but we were having such a lovely time in the lodge were barely noticed!
reviews.title: Pure heaven for 48 Hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute the car drove onto the Castle Leslie Estate on last Sunday Morning, I could feel the tension seeping from my body, sweeping up the driveway with the winter watering sun, to walking in the door with the huge fire, we were greeted amicably by the Receptionist and what I assume was the Manager (a very pleasant lady) - she gave us a mini tour of the dining room/sitting rooms and drawing rooms and answered all our questions, we were thrilled to hear that we were staying in the Nursery which was beyond fabulous, the views I will never ever forget as long as I live, the room is decorated all in blue with the bathroom contained in a Wendy House, it was lovely the clean air and the no television (dont mention WiFi) was such a fantastic experience. we walked down the short drive to Conors bar and enjoyed an extremely pleasant lunch here, the dinner we had in Snaffles bar and we were amazed with the choice on the menu, there was everything from fish (I had monkfish) to Venission to pork and beef the choice was out of this world, the desserts of course were equally enjoyable I had orange creme brulee it was past one of the most amazing things I have eaten in my life. We mangaged a good walk down to the boathouse and back before breakfast the next morning, and were happy to sit down to another fantastic served meal again everything from Eggs benedict to smoked salmon. It was with great disappointment that I left this wonderful establishment, never forget the experience and the warmth of the staff that were so helpful and answered all our questions about celebrity weddings !!! Keep up the good work,
reviews.title: Nothing but luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night in the castle leslie lodge. Standard ensuite room was nothing but luxury. Tolietries,irish handmade products. The softest dressing gowns and sleepers plus bed. T.v and tea/coffee making facilities in room. As it was my birthday my husband secretly had organised a beautiful bouquet of flowers freshly picked from the surrounding gardens. Horse stables at back of accommodation. Spa a must, got nails done. Staff throughout Leslie very nice. Restaurant gorgeous and food absolutely delicious (locally sourced). At breakfast you were spoilt for choice. Walk to castle itself 5 mins. Village beside castle very quaint. Would go back again without thinking.:))
reviews.title: The Royal Treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Castle Leslie is the real deal Irish Castle Experience. Walk through ancient heavy doors; Riding/hunting Closet on your left (about the size of my entire apartment) huge burning fireplace on your right. Museum Quality furnishings, paintings and tapestries in every room and hallway. Spectacular manicured lawns and sculptures. A peaceful and quiet private lake with trails. We went riding with a small group, riding well-bred and healthy horses stabled on the property. We selected our room (the mauve room) because of its furnishings, and interior design (fireplace next to the deep soaking tub, why not?) but sneaking a peek into other open rooms in the castle.... Every room is amazing and has unique charm and character. This is a truly one of a kind place, perfect for a romantic getaway or small group looking for a private and peaceful destination in a historic setting. Give yourself plenty of time here and don't stay fewer than 3 nights.
reviews.title: a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Castle (4 adults and 2 children) and everyone loved it. The girls went to the spa and the boys went fishing on the lake. The weather was beautiful. The kids all went horseriding. Food was great, rooms have all been renovated and are looking great and there is something for everyone.
reviews.title: Castle Leslie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely. The room was spacious and very old world. The bar had a good atmosphere and the food in the restaurant was gorgeous. The staff were extremely friendly and so helpful. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Just after returning from an overnight stay here, and I can't wait to return again. From the second you enter the estate, it's like entering another world, so calm and peaceful. We stayed at the castle and it was amazing, so relaxed and peaceful. The staff are fantastic, and I must give special recognition to Owen! He was brilliant, brought us to our room (the calm room), and gave us all the information about the hotel. Later he showed us some of the other rooms in the castle and gave us the information and history about the castle. He is fantastic at his job.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: We later visited the Victorian treatment rooms, at the lodge, and ate at snaffles restaurant. The food was simply amazing, such a selection and variety, all locally sourced. The staff were able to make recommendations and describe each dish, they were extremely attentive at all time. My husband had the pigeon starter, and fillet steak main course, both cooked to perfection. I decided on the mussel and coconut soup and venison, from the estate, the flavours were amazing, and the venison simply melted in your mouth.
reviews.title: Pure bliss on the lough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Castle Leslie is the perfect escape from the madness and is somewhere to relax and soak up all the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

description: Castle Leslie Estate, nestled on 1,000 acres of undulating Irish countryside, dotted with ancient woodland and glittering lakes, is one of the last great Irish Castle estates still in the hands of its founding family. Castle Estate is waiting to be discovered. Located in Co. Monaghan, Ireland, the Estate is only 80 minutes from Dublin. The Castle (20 individual guestroom), at the heart of the Estate, offers authentic original interiors and old-style hospitality and is a complete respite from the world. The Lodge (29 guestrooms) is the social hub of the Estate and brings locals and guests together in an atmosphere of conviviality and comfort. The Old Stable Mews (12 two bed Mews) & Village Cottages (12 four and five bed cottages) are the perfect spot for families and groups that want the convenience of hotel living combined with private self catering.The Estate offers an idyllic setting for outdoor activity and adventure. It’s the perfect place to discover the thrill of exploring the countryside on horseback or foot. You can spend a few hours fishing on one of Ireland's best-preserved lakes. Alternatively, you might prefer to enjoy a massage in the Victorian Treatment Rooms at the end of an activity packed day or relax with a book in one of our many beautiful rooms. Other activities include Hot Air Balloon rides, carriage rides, kayaking, clay pigeon shooting, and the Kids Saddle Club.
